intro: Cussonia lukwangulensis, commonly known as the Lukwangulensis arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
